revised_title: Newton and the Classical Scholia: A Reinterpretation
tldr: This article examines the 'classical' Scholia, a set of draft notes composed by Isaac Newton in the 1690s, which discuss the supposed anticipations of his doctrines in the thought of Graeco-Roman antiquity. The author argues that these Scholia were an important part of Newton's philosophy and that studying them deepens our understanding of his philosophical endeavor and its relation to the contemporary English natural-philosophical and theological context.
